p: The MIC of Jatropha latex was determined using Mueller–Hinton broth microdilution [ 9]. MIC determination was performed by a serial dilution technique using 12-well microtiter plates. MHB (100 μL) was placed into the well/plate and Jatropha latex (100 μL) in the dilution series. 10 μL bacterial cell suspensions were placed in each well/plate. Microplates were incubated aerobically at 35 ± 2°C for 16–20 h. The lowest concentrations without visible growth completely inhibited the bacteria (MIC) [ 10]. The MBC was defined as the lowest concentration of the extract that did not allow any growth [ 10]. The MBC of Jatropha latex was determined following the methods described by [ 11] with slight modifications. Wells were subcultured using a 10 μL inoculating loop on to a 5% sheep BAP at (35 ± 2)°C for 16–20 h incubation.
